name: NBA Jam 2000
description: NBA Jam 2000 is a sports Nintendo 64 game made by Acclaim in Salt Lake City, Utah as licensed basketball simulation for the 1999–2000 NBA season. It also contained elements of the classic NBA Jam series in Jam Mode. The rosters were accurate as of October 16, 1999. All photos and video used are from the 1998–1999 NBA season. It was announced on June 16, 1999. The cover features former Sacramento Kings power forward Chris Webber. The game also features Kevin Harlan on play-by-play with Marv Albert as the studio host. The Utah Jazz' Dan Roberts provides the arena announcing.
